title.narrative: IR 3.2 ENREGISTREMENT DES NAISSANCES

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 3.2: By 2018, the birth registration rate of children improves from 28 % to at least 50 % nationally, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTIONPCR 3: By the end of 2018, the prevention and protection against all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation, as well as access to state civil service and legal protection, are significantly and equitably reinforced.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.2: By 2018, the birth registration rate of children improves from 28 % to at least 50 % nationally

description.narrative: In 2019, a total of 1,253,392 births were registered by the civil registration system, with UNICEF support, accounting for 258,664 more children than 2018. This raises the total number of children registered since 2013 to 7,337,348. A particular focus was placed on the registration of 39,948 vulnerable children (including 4,565 CAAFAG: children associated with armed forces and armed groups) through the issuance of birth certificates via supplementary judgments. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Total number of children registered in primary and secondary civil status offices, including those created in maternity hospitals (disaggregated by sex).[Nombre total d'enfants enregistres dans les bureaux principaux et secondaires, y compris ceux crees dans les maternites (desagrege par sexe)](39277)

of vulnerable children and EAFGA (Enfants associes aux forces et groupes armesChildren associated with armed forces and groups) registered after the grace period by obtaining a supplementary judgment (disaggregation by sex).[ d'enfants vulnerables et EAFGA enregistres hors delai grace a l'obtention d'un jugement suppletif (desagregation par sexe).](48740)
% of newborns registered in the civil registry.[% d'enfants parmi les nouveau-nes enregistres a l'etat civil.](48738)

Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State

baseline.value: The law on the protection of the child which entered into force in 2009 foresaw free universal birth registration within the first 90 days. The Code de la Famille was not aligned to the law in that it foresaw free universal birth registration within the f

target.value: 2019:The law on the protection of the child and the Code de la Famille are aligned in allowing 90 days for free universal registration of births.

actual.value: 2019:Yes (The law on the protection of the child and the Code de la Famille are aligned in allowing 90 days for free universal registration of births)
